sense.name: look at or indulge in sentiment
sense.examples: We should not sentimentalize cultural populism or philistinism. He must never try to sentimentalize this man. Some of McCullers' ourcasts seem sentimentalized to me. I tried not to sentimentalize. And only a fool or a fraud could sentimentalize its cruel reality. His feelings are rendered without an adult's tendancy to sentimentalize.

sense.name: make sentimental
sense.examples: Somehow her clear message has been sentimentalized into flower and candy giving Quinn doesn't sentamentalize or demonize either the Europeans or the Indians. Movies do sentimentalize that ritual, I think. The older sister's love for the younger might sentimentalize the story. The opera lavishly sentimentalizes unrequited love.
